publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3964# Mr Kenneth Macintosh: No Smoking Day 2003—That the Parliament notes that No Smoking Day will take place on 12 March 2003; recognises that tobacco is responsible for more than one in every five deaths and is the single biggest preventable cause of death in Scotland; further notes the evidence that people consistently underestimate the health impacts of both smoking and passive smoking; recognises that the introduction of restrictions on smoking in the workplace is effective in motivating smokers to quit; acknowledges that cutting smoking rates in Scotland will reduce the high incidence of cancer and heart disease caused by smoking and passive smoking; supports the work done by agencies who campaign against tobacco in Scotland and the UK; applauds the work of health professionals in helping smokers to give up, and congratulates the 120,000 Scots who are expected to make a quit attempt on No Smoking Day 2003.
S1M-3964# No Smoking Day 2003 (lodged on 26 February 2003) Robin Harper*, Sarah Boyack*, Bristow Muldoon*, Scott Barrie*, Tommy Sheridan*
